time out.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a short break during a sports match when the teams can rest, get instructions from their manager etc
time out.translation[0].definitions[0].e: With 15.7 seconds left, Washington State called time out.
time out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: an occasion when a computer stops using a particular program because the user has not done any work for a period of time
time out.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a weekly London listings magazine which gives details of all the films, plays, sports games, and other events and activities taking place in the city. It is read especially by young people.
